parameters.message:

Hi {{ $json.fields['Full Name'] }},

Thanks for reaching out! We‚Äôve received your request and our team will get back to you as soon as possible.

Here‚Äôs a quick summary:

  • Company:{{ $json.fields['Company Name'] }}
  • Job Title: {{ $json.fields['Job Title'] }}

    • We‚Äôll be in touch very soon!

    ‚Äî The Team
parameters.subject: Thanks for reaching out!

parameters.content:
## üéØ Workflow Goal

**Still manually checking form responses in your inbox?**

**What if every submission landed neatly in Airtable ‚Äî and you got a clean Slack message instantly?**

That‚Äôs exactly what this workflow does.
No code, no delay ‚Äî just a smooth automation:

**Tally ‚Üí Airtable ‚Üí Slack**

## üß© Step 1 ‚Äì Connect Tally to n8n

**Let‚Äôs start by connecting your Tally form to n8n using a webhook.**

This will trigger your workflow every time someone submits the form ‚Äî no manual checking needed.

### üîß What we‚Äôre setting up
- A **Webhook** node that receives form responses from Tally.

### ‚úÖ How to set it up
1. Add a **Webhook** node in n8n.
2. Set the **HTTP Method** to `POST`.
3. Copy the webhook URL.
4. Go to your Tally form settings ‚Üí **Integrations** ‚Üí **Webhooks**.
5. Paste your webhook URL and activate it.

Now every new submission will ping n8n automatically.

### üì¶ Output
The full form response arrives in `{{$json.fields}}`, as an array of objects like:

```json
[
  {
    "label": "Full Name",
    "value": "Jane Doe"
  },
  {
    "label": "Email",
    "value": "jane.doe@example.com"
  }
]

## üß± Step 3 ‚Äì Send the cleaned data to Airtable

**Now that your Tally response is nice and tidy, it‚Äôs time to store it.**

We‚Äôre going to create a new record in your Airtable base using the structured data from Step 2.

### üîß What we‚Äôre setting up
- An **Airtable > Create Record** node that saves each submission as a new row.

### ‚úÖ How to set it up
1. Add an **Airtable node** and choose the **‚ÄúCreate Record‚Äù** operation.
2. Connect your Airtable account.
3. Select the correct **Base** and **Table**.
4. Map the cleaned fields to your Airtable columns:

- Name ‚Üí `{{$json["Full Name"]}}`
- Email ‚Üí `{{$json["Email"]}}`
- Phone ‚Üí `{{$json["Phone"]}}`
- Company ‚Üí `{{$json["Company"]}}`
- Anything else you need

### üì¶ Output
Each time someone fills out the form, a new Airtable row is created automatically.

## üì¨ Step 4 ‚Äì Send an automatic Slack message

**After storing the data in Airtable, let‚Äôs notify your team ‚Äî instantly.**

We‚Äôll send a professional Slack message each time someone fills out your Tally form.

### üîß What we‚Äôre setting up
- A **Slack > Send a Message** node to post in your chosen channel or send a DM.

### ‚úÖ How to set it up
1. Add a **Slack node** and choose the **‚ÄúSend Message‚Äù** operation.
2. Connect your Slack account.
3. Pick the right **channel** or user.
4. Customize the message using the cleaned data:

```plaintext
üéâ New form submission!

üë§ Name: {{$json["Full Name"]}}
üìß Email: {{$json["Email"]}}
üìû Phone: {{$json["Phone"]}}
üè¢ Company: {{$json["Company"]}}
(Optional) Use Markdown formatting in your message for extra clarity.

üì¶ Output
You‚Äôll receive a neat Slack message every time ‚Äî no inbox clutter, no delay.

yaml
Copier
Modifier

## ‚úÖ Step 5 ‚Äì Workflow complete

**And that‚Äôs it!** You‚Äôve just built a full automation that captures Tally form responses, cleans the data, stores it in Airtable, and sends a custom Slack message ‚Äî all on autopilot.

No more copy-paste. No more missed submissions.

Now every lead is organized, stored, and shared with your team‚Ä¶ instantly.
